results.title: By design?
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Diane O'Connor
results.brief_description: Provides a behind the scene look at the world of fashion. People from Cherry Lane fashion house, “Dolly” and “Mode” magazines and the Australian Wool corporation talk about what is involved in predicting fashions trends, designing, producing garments and putting together fashion.

results.title: By design
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Geoffrey Collings
results.brief_description: A jet plane, a boomerang, and a locomotive are shown as examples of successful design in which the right materials are used for the right purposes. Showing examples of the work of Australia’s industrial designers, the film explains that the purpose for which an article is intended determines the final design. Examples include household articles such as an electric iron, comfortable chairs, lamps, and saucepans.

results.title: By Brakhage: an anthology
results.brief_description: Influential American avant-garde artist Stan Brakhage (1933-2003) made nearly four hundred films over fifty years. Addressing grand themes of birth, sex and death, Brakhage pioneered the art of handmade films - scratching, drawing and painting directly on to the film itself. This compilation contains twenty-six works by Brakhage including some of his most famous titles. Interviews and audio commentary by Brakhage, as well as an accompanying booklet, provide a fascinating insight into his philosophical and technical processes.

results.title: By-pass
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Arch Nicholson
results.brief_description: A short film illustrating a typical administrative problem for discussion. Two office workers produce innovative designs that may prove to have long range cost-saving benefits. Neither of their superiors appears to be appreciative. One designer decides to by-pass his approach to his superior. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Buzz Lightyear of star command: the adventure begins
results.creator_credit: Mark McCorkle, Bob Schooley and Tad Stones
results.brief_description: Wonderfully humorous animated children’s film, based around the character Buzz Lightyear from Pixar’s enormously successful “Toy story”. Buzz (a vainglorious and brave space hero) and his partner Agent Z are sent to rescue a swarm of Little Green Men, kidnapped by the evil Zurg, who is trying to discover the secret of their united minds. When Z is lost in battle a disheartened Buzz becomes determined to work alone. When he is ordered to team with Mira Nova, a crack rookie Space Ranger who is also a princess, Buzz faces some serious competition. “Buzz Lightyear” uses traditional cell animation, instead of the digital animation utilised to such great effect in “Toy story”, but the humour of this film easily matches the amusing parodying tone of Pixar’s other feature films, which should prove a delight for children. Features the voices of Tim Allen, Wayne Knight, Nicole Sullivan, Stephen Furst, Larry Miller, Adam Carolla, Diedrich Bader and Patrick Warburton.

results.title: Buzkashi: the national game (D)
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation and Hermann Schlenker
results.brief_description: WARNING: THIS FILM CONTAINS SOME VISUALLY DISTURBING IMAGES Buzkashi is the once forbidden sport performed on horseback by the tribes of Afghanistan. Buzkashi requires incredible riding ability, as the opposing teams battle for a head-less calf. the intense pride and rivalry of a tribal society, as well as the role of physical superiority and competition are implicit. No commentary - natural sound track only.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation and Hermann Schlenker

results.title: Buying Toys
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Examines types of toys appropriate for different age groups, storage hints, the issue of sexism and how to resist pressures from TV, advertising and cartoons.

results.title: Buying services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows the need for savings and the importance of investing wisely. Uses the experiences of a young man involved in an automobile accident to illustrate the importance of being financially prepared through having shopped around for the best insurance cover. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Buying on credit
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Creative Establishment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows what credit is, how it works and some of the dangers involved in using credit. Uses a conversation between three young men to introduce finance charges, bank loans, downpayment, interest and instalment payments. Suitable for upper secondary level.
